Cascade Products
Cascade products are composite structures that can be built from a given list of permutation groups and/or transformation semigroups. They are substructures of the iterated wreath product of the components.
CascadeShell The components are given a list where the order does matter. The first one is the top level, the independent component. The cascade shell should be thought only as a framework in which we can coordinatize states and transformations. <#Include Label="CascadeShell"> <#Include Label="CoordValSets"> <#Include Label="AllCoords"> <#Include Label="SizeOfWreathProduct"> <#Include Label="NumberOfDependencyFunctionArguments">
Cascaded States States in the cascade product are n-tuples. The possible coordinate values in each position are the sates/points of the corresponding component. Therefore the valid concrete coordinate values are positive integers.
